```{r}
library(rlang)


a=1
b=2

rlang::expr(a+b)
rlang::expr(a + !!b)      ## a + 2
rlang::expr(!!a + !!b)      ## 1 + 2

rlang::expr(a + {{b}} )     ## a + ~2
```

---

```{r}
e = rlang::expr(a+b)
e                         ## a+b
{{e}}                     ## a+b

eval(e)                   ## a+b 


##
expr(log(e))              ##  log(e)
expr(log(!!e))            ##  log(a+b)
expr(log( {{e}}) )        ##  log(~a+b)


eval(expr(log(!!e)))      ## 1.1
if(F) eval(expr(log( {{e}} )))  ## Error



expr(log( eval(e ) ))   ##   log(eval(e))

```

```{r}

# how to capture expression BEFORE evaluated?
z <- rlang::expr(y <- x * 10)
z

z = expr(1+1)
as.list(z)
eval(z)

x = 2
z = expr(1 + .(x))
z
eval(z)

name="jim"
eval(print("hello",  {{name}}))


```

z
